intro: Faramea martiana, commonly known as the red-veined or purple-leafed faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, glossy, dark green leaves with prominent red veins. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Faramea martiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
